content.description: The following question is based on the excerpt below.
content.question: If figured bass symbols were applied to the first two chords in measure 8, the Arabic numerals would best be written as

choices.label: The figure presents two sets of inversion symbols. The first is 7/5/3 and the second is 8/6/4.
The figure presents two sets of inversion symbols. The first is 8/6/4 and the second is 7/5/3.
The figure presents two sets of inversion symbols. The first is 6/5 and the second is 4/3.
The figure presents two sets of inversion symbols. The first is 6/5 and the second is 4/2.

content.answer: The figure presents two sets of inversion symbols. The first is 8/6/4 and the second is 7/5/3.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
